info.name: Barclays 2022 CBDC Hackathon API
info.description:
API for the Barclays 2022 CBDC Hackathon.

Please ensure you include your API key in the `x-api-key` header for your requests.

item.name: Get details about a specific party registered at a PIP.

request.description: Returns the details about the specific party registered at the PIP.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

request.description: De-register a specific party from a PIP.

Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Get details of all parties registered at the PIP.

query.description: Zero-based page index (0..N) of the page you want to return.
The max. number of items (size) a page will contain.

request.description:
Get details of all parties registered at the PIP.

Paging

This endpoint can potentially return quite a large result and so you must use paging to control the size of the response. Pagination is handled by using the `pageIndex` and `pageSize` parameters. - The `pageIndex` refers to the index of the page of data you want returned. It is 0-indexed meaning the first page will always have the `pageIndex` value of 0. - The `pageSize` refers to the maximum number of entries you would like to see within a single page (hence page size). - You cannot request a `pageSize` greater than 1000.

response.name: Parties page.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Register a party with the PIP.

request.description:
Register a party with the PIP.

It is the PIP which holds the personally identifiable data of the party and
which interacts with the CBDC core ledger on behalf of the party.


Once registered you can then open accounts belonging to that party.
In the real world the registration would also include performing KYC and AML checks.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Close the account at the PIP.

request.description: Close the account. Note: the account must have a 0 balance for this API call to succeed.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Withdraw a cash amount from the account.

request.description:
Simulation of withdrawing money from the account.

Amount details

The amount must be given in the units of the currency (for GBP that means pence, for USD/EUR: cents, etc.). For example if you wanted 1/$1/1 to be the amount you would give the value 100 (as the value refers to the amount of pence/cents).

response.name: Updated account details after the withdrawal.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Deposit a cash amount into the account.

request.description:
Simulation of depositing cash into the account.

Amount details

The amount must be given in the units of the currency (for GBP that means pence, for USD/EUR: cents, etc.). For example if you wanted 1/$1/1 to be the amount you would give the value 100 (as the value refers to the amount of pence/cents).

response.name: Updated account details after the deposit.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Get details of all of the accounts at the PIP.

query.description: Zero-based page index (0..N) of the page you want to return.
The max. number of items (size) a page will contain.

request.description:
Get details of all of the accounts at the PIP.

Balance details

The `balance` is given in the units of the currency (for GBP that means pence, for USD/EUR: cents, etc.). For your convenience there is also a field, `formattedBalance` which displays the balance as a decimal number. For example if you had 1.03 in the account you would receive a `balance` of 103 and a `formattedBalance` of 1.03.

Paging

This endpoint can potentially return quite a large result and so you must use paging to control the size of the response. Pagination is handled by using the `pageIndex` and `pageSize` parameters. - The `pageIndex` refers to the index of the page of data you want returned. It is 0-indexed meaning the first page will always have the `pageIndex` value of 0. - The `pageSize` refers to the maximum number of entries you would like to see within a single page (hence page size). - You cannot request a `pageSize` greater than 1000.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Open a CBDC account at the PIP.

request.description:
Opens a CBDC account in the given currency at the payment interface provider.
This account is essentially a proxy for the CBDC account stored on the central bank's core ledger.
You do not need to interact directly with the core ledger - the PIP will do that behind the scenes.
You need to provide a reference to the ID of the party which is opening the account in the request body.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

Pagination is handled by using the `pageIndex` and `pageSize` parameters. - The `pageIndex` refers to the index of the page of data you want returned. It is 0-indexed meaning the first page will always have the `pageIndex` value of 0. - The `pageSize` refers to the maximum number of entries you would like to see within a single page (hence page size). - You cannot request a `pageSize` greater than 1000.

request.description:
Create a new PIP which will have access to the CBDC ledger for the given currency.
Once created, you can register parties with the PIP and also open up accounts.
An account at a PIP is a proxy for an account on the CBDC ledger.

(Required) Identifier for the banking entity (commercial bank/pip) which you are simulating is making this API call.
This is the banking entity which needs to have been granted consent from the party.
(Required) Identifier for the consent resource which grants access to perform this request.

The max. number of items (size) a page will contain.

request.description:
Get a page listing the environments you have created.

Paging

This endpoint can potentially return quite a large result and so you must use paging to control the size of the response. Pagination is handled by using the `pageIndex` and `pageSize` parameters. - The `pageIndex` refers to the index of the page of data you want returned. It is 0-indexed meaning the first page will always have the `pageIndex` value of 0. - The `pageSize` refers to the maximum number of entries you would like to see within a single page (hence page size). - You cannot request a `pageSize` greater than 1000.

response.name: Page containing details of the environments.

item.name: Get details about a specific currency.

request.description: Retrieve details about a specific currency including the CBDC accounts on the currency's core ledger, as well as the commercial banks and pips registered to operate within that currency.

response.name: Currency Details.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Terminate a currency (and by extension it's CBDC Ledger and other child resources).

request.description:
Terminates a currency. This will mean the CBDC ledger for that currency will no longer be available for experimentation.
All child resources of the currency (the CBDC ledger accounts, the PIPs, the Commercial Banks) must be terminated
prior to issuing this request, otherwise the request will fail.

response.name: Currency Details.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

It is 0-indexed meaning the first page will always have the `pageIndex` value of 0. - The `pageSize` refers to the maximum number of entries you would like to see within a single page (hence page size). - You cannot request a `pageSize` greater than 1000.

item.name: Create a new commercial bank entity.

request.description:
Create a new commercial bank which will manage its own ledger of accounts in the given currency.
Once created, you can register parties with the commercial bank and also open up accounts owned by a registered party.

item.name: Get details about a specific CBDC account.

header.description: (Required) Identifier for the pip which you are simulating is making this API call.

request.description:
Retrieve details about a specific CBDC account including its balance.

As these details are for an account on the core ledger there is no information about
the party which owns the account. This is because the core ledger, by design, does
not store any information which can directly identify the party.

This API endpoint is intended to be used by PIPs.

item.name: Withdraw a cash amount from the account.

header.description: (Required) Identifier for the pip which you are simulating is making this API call.

request.description:
Simulation of withdrawing money from the account.

Amount details

The amount must be given in the units of the currency (for GBP that means pence, for USD/EUR: cents, etc.). For example if you wanted 1/$1/1 to be the amount you would give the value 100 (as the value refers to the amount of pence/cents).

Simulation of depositing cash into the account.

Amount details

The amount must be given in the units of the currency (for GBP that means pence, for USD/EUR: cents, etc.). For example if you wanted 1/$1/1 to be the amount you would give the value 100 (as the value refers to the amount of pence/cents).

item.name: Send a HTTP ping request and expect a pong back if everything is OK.

request.description: Useful for testing whether you can reach the server or not. This request does not require you to provide the API key.
